qas.question: What did the clans people all have in common?

answers.text: theoretically descending from a common ancestor

qas.question: What gave them a sense of solidarity?
What was the territory occupied by a single tribe?

context: The tribes were ruled by <a0_0>clans (ród)<a0_0/> consisting of people <a2_0>related by blood or marriage<a2_0/> and <a1_0>theoretically descending from a common ancestor<a1_0/>, giving the ród/clan a highly developed sense of solidarity. (See gens.) The starosta (or starszyna) had judicial and military power over the ród/clan, although this power was often exercised with an assembly of elders. Strongholds called <a3_0>grόd<a3_0/> were built where the religious cult was powerful, where trials were conducted, and where clans gathered in the face of danger. The <a4_0>opole<a4_0/> was the territory occupied by a single tribe. (Manteuffel 1982, p. 44)
